Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the statement that people can no longer seek asylum from the United States, when in reality, they can apply for asylum once they are in the country.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it fails to provide evidence or data to back up the assertion that seeking asylum from the United States is no longer possible.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that seeking asylum from abroad is the only option, disregarding the fact that people can still seek asylum once they are in the United States.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that people can apply for asylum once they are in the United States, which goes against the statement made by Biden.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, which is that the statement made by Biden is an oversimplification of the asylum process and fails to provide the full context of the policies in place.
